## Random Variable Basics


- a random variable is a mathetmatical object which takes certain values with certain probabilities
- we have *discrete* and *continuous* random varibles although we can always approximate a continous one with a discrete one
- A simple discrete random varibale X can be described as a *single random* draw from a "box" containing tickets, each with numbers written on them
